resources.string: Based on Open Camera by Mark Harman\n\nReleased under the GPL v3 or later

Touch to focus, and press the blue camera button to take photos. For more help, click Online help from Settings.\n\nPrivacy Policy: This application does not send personal data to third parties. Access to the camera, microphone, and location is only used for saving your photos and videos.
Screen is locked\nswipe the screen to unlock
Sorry, auto-level not supported\non this device
Failed to stamp info to photo
Error, video file may be corrupted
Not enough free space to record video
No file dialog found on this device, ghost image option is not supported
Failed to restore settings from backup file
Camera permission is required to enable the camera
Storage read/write permission is required to save photos
Microphone permission is required to record video with audio
Location permission is required for geotagging
Auto-level will automatically rotate photos so that they appear level.\n\nNote that this means images will come out a slightly lower resolution (due to the rotation and cropping that\'s required).

DNG files contain the full uncompressed and unprocessed information from your camera.

Most gallery apps won't recognise DNG, instead they should be used with specialised apps like Snapseed or Lightroom.

Note that various processing options such as "Stamp photos" and "Auto-level" will only apply to the JPEG images, and not the DNG images.

DNG files take up a lot of space; a file explorer app may be useful for transferring or deleting them.

DNG files are only saved in Standard or DRO photo modes.

HDR mode is useful for shots with a large variation in brightness. It works by taking multiple shots at different exposures, and combining them to create the final image.

Note that HDR is not suitable for scenes with fast movement, and may result in less accurate colour reproduction.

Taking photos in HDR mode will be slower.
Are you sure you want to reset all settings to default?
Are you sure you want to restore all settings from file? All current settings will be overwritten!
Use face detection instead of focus areas
Take a photo just by touching the preview
Set minimal display brightness when burst mode is active
Lock the screen when timer or burst is running
Start capture or timer after the face is detected. Don\'n forget to enable face detection before using this mode.
%s\n\nNoise level sensitivity for audio (loud noise) option
%s\n\nPlay a sound when taking a photo
Beep when timer is counting down or for burst mode delay
Speak the countdown for timer or burst mode delay (from 60 seconds)
If timer beep disabled, play a sound when timer started or stopped
%s\n\nA space between control panel buttons and shutter button for \"Phone 2\", \"Tablet\" and \"Universal\" GUI type
Automatically switch sliders visibility when changing measuring mode
Show the -/+ buttons for zoom control
Show the slider for zoom control
In this section you can select the items that are displayed in main popup menu.
In this section you can disable unused or malfunctioning modes. The settings are saved separately for each camera.
Show the icon for taking photos and recording videos. Useful if your device has a hardware shutter button and you\'d rather use that.
Only hide on-screen virtual navigation buttons
Whether to display the popup \"toast\" messages
Display moving thumbnail animation when taking a photo
Display a border on the display to indicate taking a photo
If enabled, the screen won\'t switch off while the application UI is active
Force screen display to be at maximum brightness, rather than device default
Resolution of the preview. If this option was changed, previous one will be ignored. This setting is saved separately for each camera and photo/video mode.
%s\n\nOption to rotate the preview (won\'t affect resultant photos/videos)
Maximum preview exposure in manual mode (won\'t affect resultant photos/videos)
Increase the center of the preview when adjusting manual focus
%s\n\nSurface for displaying preview. Switch this option only if you know what you do
Display the current camera zoom level on screen (when zoomed in)
Display the current white balance temperature
Display the remaining device storage space on screen
Display the current device orientation angle on screen
%s\n\nHighlight color for when camera is nearly level
Display the compass direction of the device on screen
Display the current time on screen
Display the current battery level on screen
Whether to show on-screen audio level when recording video
Alternative focus and metering zone indication

%s\n\nA crop guide displays a rectangle showing what the specified aspect ratio looks like - useful if you plan to crop the photo/video afterwards to a different aspect ratio. Requires WYSIWYG photo mode, or being in video mode.
OSD update frequency. Increasing this value will will make the indication smoother, but the battery will discharge faster
Decrease the OSD frequency when taking a photo or recording a video
Pause the screen after taking a photo, with the option to share or delete the photo
If set, the orientation of the device will be ignored, and the orientation of the photo/video will be with respect to the specified orientation
If enabled, application will still show above any lockscreen (you\'ll still have to unlock to access Settings, Gallery etc)
You must restart the application to apply this option
Manual focus range limit for for more precise control
%s\n\nPositive values correspond to short distances, negative values to long distances.
%s\n\nSpace between a rows in luminance channel. Used when uncompressed output option is enabled. This setting is saved separately for each camera.
%s\n\nSpace betweena rows in chroma channels. Used when uncompressed output option is enabled. This setting is saved separately for each camera.
Whether to auto-focus when application is started. If you have the problem of flash turning on when starting, disable this option
Force focus when face detected in autofocus mode. Only one face supported.
Set focus zone in the center of the frame at startup

Workaround for bug on Samsung Galaxy S5 with UHD, where if the user switches to another (non-continuous-video) focus mode, then goes to Settings, then returns and records video, the preview freezes and the video is corrupted
Enable this if your device has buggy flash behaviour with Camera2 API
Use 1920x1088 video resolution instead of 1920x1080. This option fix the green stripe bug on some MediaTek devices
Increase accelerometer and magnetic sensor update speed
Create full-size compressed copy of photo when capturing an uncompressed photo. Use this option if you have problems with YUV capturing.
Reset manual ISO mode when connected to the camera. Use this option if autofocus works incorrectly after connecting to the camera and ISO mode is manual
Lock preview FPS to video frame rate. Use this option if video frame rate control does not work on your device.
Images will be rotated so they are automatically level (photos only) (slower to take photos, and may fail on devices with too low memory)
Flip horizontally photos from front camera
Use YUV 420 output instead of compressed JPEG. Speeds up saving and improves image quality when using image post-processing. Can work incorrectly on some devices.
Metadata that is stored inside the JPEG file
Add to comment information about device position
Add to comment information about camera mode
Add to comment information about sensor settings
Add to comment information about image processing
Expobracketing settings. Most of the options in this section also apply to HDR.
%s\n\nNumber of images for exposure bracketing mode
%s\n\nHow many stops to add for the brightest image
%s\n\nHow many stops to subtract for the darkest image
If possible, use ISO adjustment for creating the darker images
%s\n\nThe delay between images is necessary for exposure compensation changing
Save all images for HDR mode

If enabled, when using HDR photo mode, the three base exposure images will be saved as well as the final HDR photo. Note this will make saving slower, especially if options like \"Stamp photos\" or Auto-level are also used.
%s\n\nLevel of the unsharp mask filter during processing HDR and DRO
%s\n\nLevel of the local contrast enhancement during processing HDR and DRO
If smart filtering is enabled, ignore it, and don\'t disable noise reduction and edge enhancement when illumination is good in HDR photo mode
Disable noise reduction and edge enhancement when capturing a burst
Stamp photos with date and time; and also GPS info if location/direction data is enabled
Stamp photos with a custom text
Allows faster capture of the HDR/expo shots. Disable this if your device has problems when taking photos with HDR or Expo photo modes.
Whether to save photos on a background thread (for faster operation)
Video stabilization reduces the shaking due to the motion of the camera in both the preview and in recorded videos
%s\n\nSet the approximate bitrate of videos (higher means better quality, but takes up more disk space; may cause video recording to fail if bitrate not supported)
%s\n\nSet the frame rate (FPS) of videos (may be approx, not guaranteed to be achieved, and may cause video recording to fail if frame rate not supported)
%s\n\nEnable a flat (log) profile for video mode
%s\n\nThe video recording will stop after the specified duration
%s\n\nIf the video has stopped after hitting the maximum duration (if set), this option will make the video restart, up to the specified number of times

%s\n\nThe video recording will stop and/or restart (see option below) when the (approximate) maximum file size is reached. Note that almost all Android devices have a maximum file size for videos (typically around 2GB or 4GB), but this option allows setting a specific value
Whether to automatically restart when the maximum file size is reached (whether the device default max file size, or user specified)
%s\n\nSet the bitrate of audio (higher means better sound quality, but takes up more disk space; may cause video recording to fail if bitrate not supported)
%s\n\nSpecify mono or stereo for recording audio (stereo only supported on some devices)

When recording video, the GUI will be locked to prevent accidentally stopping recording. Swipe the screen to unlock. Note that video recording will always stop if the app goes into background or the screen is blanked.
%s\n\nCreate a subtitles (.SRT) file storing date and time; and also GPS info if location/direction data is enabled
Force 4K UHD video (only works on some devices)

Enable 3840x2160 resolution for video recording on back camera - this option is a hack that may allow 4K devices on 4K cameras that don\'t expose the option to 3rd party camera apps. This isn\'t guaranteed to work, please test before working.
Stop video recording if battery level is critically low. This helps reduce the risk of videos being corrupted if your device suddenly switches off due to running out of power.
If enabled, flash will switch on/off when recording video (can be used to tell camera is still recording at a distance)
%s\n\nCompensate flickering at the rate of the power supply frequency
%s\n\nDisable noise reduction and edge enhancement when illumination is good. The filters will be disabled if current ISO value is less or equal to the selected value.
Folder to save the photo files in
%s\n\nFolder to save the video files in
Whether to use Android 5\'s Storage Access Framework for saving photos and videos
The prefix to use for the save filenames for photos
The prefix to use for the save filenames for videos
%s\n\nWhether to use local or UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) time for naming photos and videos
Store GPS location data in the photos/videos
Store GPS compass direction in the photos
If location data is enabled, only take photo/video if location data is available
Launch program website in your browser
Enables Android 5\'s Camera2 API - offers extra features, but may not work properly on all devices (will cause a restart)
If you like this app, please consider making a donation to support development. Thanks!
Wallet number has been copied to clipboard
Backup the settings to a file. Backup will be saved in photo/video folder.
